alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued August 20 at 4:41AM EDT until August 21 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM NOON EDT TODAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...From noon EDT today through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds will be increasing through today and this evening, bringing a corresponding building of surf heights starting this afternoon. Rip current risk will start off moderate this morning but then become high this afternoon through Monday.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
